definition: (of an uneducated person) to mingle with the cognoscenti/to pose as a culture lover/to be a culture snob/having pretensions to culture
to add/to attach/to be close to/to be attached
ordinary/to use

sentences.english: And I know I may be an artsy person in sb′s eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我知道可能在別人眼裏我是個附庸風雅的的人。

sentences.english: The whole arty get-up seemed oddly at variance with the way she behaved.
sentences.chinese: 她那套附庸風雅的穿戴似乎跟她的舉止格格不入。

sentences.english: The other films were arty-farty and mostly too long.
sentences.chinese: 其它的電影都是附庸風雅的並且大部分都很長。

sentences.english: The other films were arty-arty and mostly too long.
sentences.chinese: 其它的電影都是附庸風雅的並且大部分都很長。

sentences.english: I wasn't interested in a snob degree.
sentences.chinese: 我對人家附庸風雅的地位沒有興趣。

sentences.english: They run a little pottery shop and cafe and are very arty -crafty.
sentences.chinese: 他們開了一家小陶器店兼咖啡館，很喜歡附庸風雅。
